reviews.review_msg: Everyone is hating but honestly I think the problem is more so the class, not the teacher. This course is way too difficult for a 2nd year class in my opinion, and it's virtually impossible for any professor - let alone someone traching a course for their 1st time - to cover all the content in the allotted time. Cool guy, terrible course content.

This guy single handedly made me realize that my 13 year old dog could also be a prof one day. The man has the IQ of a pickle and the public speaking abilities of a mute baboon. How he ended up teaching 207 is the 8th wonder of the world, says recent study.

This class made me question whether or not I wanted to be in the BPK program anymore. What already was a difficult class was made even harder by him going over minimal concepts in an endless stream of pages in the textbook. Studying for exams were impossible as he gave no advice or practice to help prepare, and exam had so many foreign concepts.

I didn't think it was possible for an already difficult class to be even harder than it should've been. The lectures only covered minimal concepts from the endless textbook pages, and studying for exams were near impossible as he gave us no help or direction to study. This class made me question whether or not I wanted to be in the BPK program.

Disgustingly terrible. He single handedly ruined my education experience and any interest I had left for BPK. He literally can't complete a single sentence without saying "like" 15 times which often made me zone out and lose focus. Both the midterm and final were IMPOSSIBLE to study for. I always felt lost no matter how prepared I was. Goodluck.

This man contributed nothing to my learning. If I said he helped me understand a single sentence out of the 240 pages of straight text lecture I would have lied. He cannot formulate a sentence without saying “like” at least 5 times. His midterm was the single most awfully worded exam I have ever written. Everyone in class had to teach themselves.
He is new, really hard to understand him for this kind of lecture materials.he used to be TA for this course apparently. Get ready to teach yourself everything.

I know it's his first time teaching a class, but this was PAINFUL. BPK 207 is already hard enough. He read directly off the notes, didn't record lectures, and Friday's were ‘integration activities' (aka he would just talk for 10 minutes and expect us to talk in groups for another 40). Hard to study for exams, and group project was barely discussed.
